meanings.definition: To touch or stroke lightly with the fingers or a feather.
meanings.sent1: She giggled when her friend started tickling her.
meanings.sent2: The children were tickling each other during playtime.
meanings.sent3: Tickling feathers were used in the prank to make him laugh.
meanings.sent4: The gentle breeze tickling the leaves made the trees seem alive.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's jokes had a way of tickling everyone's funny bone.

meanings.definition: A sensation caused by light touching or stroking.
meanings.sent1: The tickling on her feet made her burst into laughter.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't control his laughter due to the tickling on his neck.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected tickling sensation on his back startled him.
meanings.sent4: The tickling of the wind on her skin felt like a gentle caress.
meanings.sent5: The tickling of excitement in her stomach told her she was nervous.
